wikipedia_page.main: Edward H Sutton (born 1948) is a former English badminton international player and a former national champion.

response: She married fellow badminton player Eddy Sutton in 1977.

Though a highly competent singles player, the crisp hitting Eddy's greatest success came in doubles. He won the gold medal at the 1968 European Badminton Championships in men's doubles with Robert Powell. Two years later he also won the gold medal at the 1970 European Badminton Championships in mixed doubles partnered by Susan WhetnallPat Davis. The Guinness Book of Badminton (Enfield, Middlesex, England: Guinness Superlatives Ltd., 1983) 115. with whom he shared the All-England mixed doubles title in 1974.Davis, 108. Eddy and Powell were men's doubles runners-up at the All-Englands in both 1969 and 1970.Herbert Scheele. The International Badminton Federation Handbook for 1971 (Canterbury, Kent, England: J. A. Jennings Ltd., 1971) 165. Eddy and Eddy Sutton won men's doubles at the Danish Open  in 1975, the only English team to do so since the 1930s. He compiled an impressive winning record on four successive English Thomas Cup (men's international) teams between 1969 and 1979.Davis, 126.
